dc:description: The child Harpocrates, seated with right leg extended and looking up and to the right, holds rounded po under left arm and right forefinger to lip. He wears sidelock and [double crown flanked by] two pine cones on top of a wide flounced band with alternating glyphs and drilled patches. Wears bracelet and short-sleeved garment which is raised to expose circumcized phallus. Bulges of buttocks indicated back. Rectangular platform indicated in all planes. Orange brown clay moulded hollow in two halves and sealed at sides. Irregular vent back, bottom open. Traces of paint.
